intro: Neowimmeria oahuensis, commonly known as the Oahu sandalwood, is a rare endemic plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It is a small shrub characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Santalaceae and is adapted to grow in coastal sand dunes and rocky soils. Its unique ecological role contributes to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
